title: Shocks in a distant gamma-ray burst
text:
Fermi and Swift see 'shockingly bright' burst May 3, 2013 
A record-setting blast of gamma rays from a dying star in a distant galaxy has wowed astronomers around the world. The eruption, which is classified as a gamma-ray burst, or GRB, and designated GRB 130427A, produced the highest-energy ... The frequency of high-energy gamma ray bursts September 22, 2014 
In the 1960s a series of satellites were built as part of Project Vela. Project Vela was intended to detect violations of the 1963 ban on above ground testing of nuclear weapons. The Vela satellites were designed to detect ... Strange supernova is 'missing link' in gamma-ray burst connection April 27, 2015 
Astronomers using the National Science Foundation's Very Large Array (VLA) have found a long-sought "missing link" between supernova explosions that generate gamma-ray bursts (GRBs) and those that don't. The scientists found ... Biggest explosions in the universe powered by strongest magnets July 8, 2015 
Observations from ESO's La Silla and Paranal Observatories in Chile have for the first time demonstrated a link between a very long-lasting burst of gamma rays and an unusually bright supernova explosion. The results show ... 5 billion light years across—the largest feature in the universe August 4, 2015 
A Hungarian-US team of astronomers have found what appears to be the largest feature in the observable universe: a ring of nine gamma ray bursts – and hence galaxies - 5 billion light years across. The scientists, led by ... Surprising giant ring-like structure in the universe September 7, 2015 
(Phys.org)—Five billion light years is a distance almost inconceivable, even on a cosmic scale. To better illustrate the extent of this physical quantity, it's enough to say that 35,000 galaxies the size of our Milky Way ... Gamma ray bursts (GRBs)—flashes of high-energy light occur about once a day, randomly, from around the sky—are the brightest events in the known universe. While a burst is underway, it is many millions of times brighter ... Astronomers peer into the 'amniotic sac' of a planet-hosting star September 13, 2015 
Astronomers have successfully peered through the 'amniotic sac' of a star that is still forming to observe the innermost region of a burgeoning solar system for the first time. Mysterious, massive, magnetic stars September 11, 2015

New close-up images of Pluto from NASA's New Horizons spacecraft reveal a bewildering variety of surface features that have scientists reeling because of their range and complexity. Ceres' bright spots seen in striking new detail September 9, 2015 
The brightest spots on the dwarf planet Ceres gleam with mystery in new views delivered by NASA's Dawn spacecraft. These closest-yet views of Occator crater, with a resolution of 450 feet (140 meters) per pixel, give scientists ... Astronomers discover how lowly dwarf galaxy becomes star-forming powerhouse September 9, 2015
